    Nakuru County Optimistic Industrial Parks Will Grow Economy

    Officials highlight industrial parks as catalysts for jobs, investment, and regional transformation.

    By Zawadi Intel Staff | Nov 30, 2025

    Construction underway at Nakuru‚Äôs flagship industrial park. ¬© Zawadi Intel

    Nakuru County officials have expressed renewed optimism that the region‚Äôs newly launched industrial parks will catalyze economic transformation. With strategic backing from both county and national governments, the initiative is expected to attract investors, create jobs, and boost local manufacturing.

    Governor‚Äôs Vision

    Governor Susan Kihika highlighted the parks‚Äô potential during a recent development forum, citing Nakuru‚Äôs central location, transport infrastructure, and skilled labor pool as key advantages. ‚ÄúWe are positioning Nakuru as a regional hub for agro-processing, textiles, and light manufacturing,‚Äù she said.

    Partnerships and Construction

    The county has already secured partnerships with private sector players and international development agencies. Construction is underway on two flagship parks in Salgaa and Njoro, with plans to expand to Gilgil and Naivasha. Officials estimate that over 15,000 direct and indirect jobs will be created in the first phase.

    Entrepreneurial Impact

    Local entrepreneurs have welcomed the move, saying it will reduce reliance on Nairobi and Mombasa for industrial services. ‚ÄúThis is a game-changer for small businesses in Nakuru,‚Äù said Mercy Wanjiru, a youth-led agribusiness founder. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll finally have access to processing facilities and export channels right here.‚Äù

    Challenges Ahead

    Experts caution that success will depend on consistent policy support, reliable utilities, and inclusive planning. Past industrial projects in Kenya have stalled due to land disputes, power outages, and lack of community engagement. Nakuru leaders say they‚Äôve learned from those lessons and are prioritizing transparency and sustainability.

    National Significance

    As construction progresses, Nakuru‚Äôs industrial parks are being watched closely as a model for county-led economic development. If successful, they could inspire similar initiatives across Kenya, helping decentralize growth and empower regional economies beyond the capital.
